topics.title: Capture Purchase Price on Add
topics.goal: Allow admins to enter and persist a purchase price when creating a book record.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: An authenticated admin opens the Add Book form.
topics.when: They enter a numeric purchase price and submit the form.
topics.then: The value is validated (required, non-negative) and written to Firestore with the new book.
topics.notes: Includes schema update, client-side validation messaging, and serverTimestamp-safe writes.

topics.title: Edit Stored Purchase Price
topics.goal: Enable admins to adjust the saved purchase price on existing books without recreating them.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: A book exists in inventory with or without a purchase price set.
topics.when: An admin invokes the edit action and updates the purchase price field.
topics.then: The new value passes validation and updates the Firestore document, reflecting immediately in the UI.
topics.notes: Guard against empty submissions; reuse validation logic from TP1; keep optimistic UI updates consistent.

topics.title: Admin Visibility of Purchase Price
topics.goal: Surface each book's purchase price to admins within list/detail panels for quick reference.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: An admin loads the inventory dashboard or detail drawer.
topics.when: Books are rendered in the admin UI.
topics.then: Each entry shows the stored purchase price (formatted currency or placeholder when missing) without affecting actions.
topics.notes: Ensure formatting is locale-aware and accessible; no exposure in public components.

topics.title: Hide Purchase Price from Public Catalog
topics.goal: Guarantee purchase price data never appears in the public catalog payloads or UI.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: A visitor browses the public catalog.
topics.when: Client-side code queries Firestore and renders cards.
topics.then: Purchase price fields are omitted or stripped before rendering so no cost data leaks publicly.
topics.notes: Double-check Firestore queries/selects and DOM templates; consider security rules to block reads from non-admin contexts.

features.description: Introduce a supplier master so admins can CRUD suppliers (Name, Location) and keep every book attached to a supplier.

topics.title: Create Supplier Records
topics.goal: Allow admins to add supplier entries with required name and location data.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: An admin opens the Supplier Master view.
topics.when: They submit the form with a supplier name and location.
topics.then: A new supplier document is persisted and listed without duplicates.
topics.notes: Surface inline validation for required fields and prevent duplicate supplier names.

topics.title: Edit or Remove Supplier Records
topics.goal: Let admins update supplier details or remove suppliers that are no longer in use.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: A supplier exists in the master list.
topics.when: An admin edits the name/location or requests deletion.
topics.then: Changes persist with audit safety, and deletions are blocked if books still reference the supplier.
topics.notes: Show dependency warnings for in-use suppliers and ensure local lists stay in sync after edits.

topics.title: Attach Supplier on Book Creation
topics.goal: Require selecting an existing supplier whenever a new book is created.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: An admin is creating a book and the supplier master already contains at least one active supplier.
topics.when: They select a supplier from the dropdown (or attempt to submit without a selection) and submit the book form.
topics.then: Valid submissions persist the supplier reference with the book, while missing/invalid selections block the save with clear feedback.
topics.notes: Sync the supplier list in real time, prevent stale selections when a supplier is deleted mid-session, and support keyboard navigation for the control.

topics.title: Edit Book-Supplier Mapping
topics.goal: Enable admins to change the supplier linked to an existing book.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: A book already has a supplier association.
topics.when: An admin selects a different supplier and confirms the edit.
topics.then: The book document updates with the new supplier, and all admin views refresh to reflect the change.
topics.notes: Prevent orphan mappings by validating the new supplier still exists; broadcast updates to caching layers if any.

features.description: Extend book-to-supplier relationships to support multiple suppliers per book and quick filtering of books per supplier.

topics.title: Multi-Supplier Selection on Book Add
topics.goal: Allow admins to associate one or more suppliers when creating a book, enforcing at least one selection.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: An admin opens the Add Book flow and the supplier master already lists available suppliers.
topics.when: They pick multiple suppliers (or attempt to submit with none) and submit the form.
topics.then: The book record persists an array of supplier references, deduplicates selections, and blocks submission when no supplier is selected.
topics.notes: Introduce an accessible multi-select UI, keep options live-updated, and mark the primary supplier if needed for downstream display.

topics.title: Edit Book Supplier Associations
topics.goal: Enable admins to add, reorder, or remove supplier links on existing books while maintaining data integrity.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: A book already stores one or more supplier references.
topics.when: An admin opens the edit dialog and adjusts the supplier list (adding, removing, or changing the primary).
topics.then: Changes persist atomically, prevent books from ending up with zero suppliers, and refresh all admin views immediately.
topics.notes: Warn before removing the last supplier, handle conflicts when a supplier was deleted elsewhere, and keep audit history of changes.

topics.title: View Books Per Supplier
topics.goal: Add a "View books" action next to each supplier to list all books referencing that supplier.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: The supplier master list is rendered with Edit/Delete actions.
topics.when: An admin clicks the "View books" button for a supplier.
topics.then: A searchable list of books linked to that supplier appears (modal or panel), showing key book metadata and empty-state messaging when none exist.
topics.notes: Ensure queries filter by supplier ID efficiently, support pagination for large result sets, and close the viewer without losing context.
